result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Tim W. Lintner was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court rec'd a proposed conditional release plan dated 3/9/22 which has been reviewed.  No objection from State.  Defense supports plan.  Court finds Deft. was committed 6/30/2014 DHHS and on March 18, 2022 Court finds release would not pose a risk.  Court orders conditional release subject to the plan attached to the order.  Court will sign the order.

09:00 AM Defendant Tim W. Lintner in court by video with attorney Brad Hansen.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Report reviewed and recommendation that Deft. be allowed to be released to a group home.  State has no objection.  Defense makes stmt. a treatment plan would need to be prepared and court will review and determine if it is appropriate.  Merline Lintner makes Stmt.  Court approves conditional release on condition that a treatment plan is prepared and approved.  Released to a group home setting w/close monitoring 24 hour staff including swallow precautions and that all medications be administered by staff, staff remain alert to emergent psychosis, communication w/payee, interaction w/parents to be closely monitored, abstain from all substances of abuse and no possession or use of any weapon.  Case manager mental health probation officer and medical staff all to be available to Deft.  Deft. to appear via video for next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 15, 2021 at 08:30 am.
